a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:02): (job security)
171db427cee236fc04af9e5de94e7c39 (14:03): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: Yo, I owe you dinner tonight.
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:07): https://twitter.com/glazou/status/21942648163 seriously?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:11): does anyone happen to have correct data about which browsers support <meta http-equiv="pragma" value="no-cache">?
171db427cee236fc04af9e5de94e7c39 (14:13): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: Yes.  Seriously.
171db427cee236fc04af9e5de94e7c39 (14:14): It was after some drinks, but still.
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:17): 171db427cee236fc04af9e5de94e7c39: what will we be using instead?
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (14:18): nothing to get upset about really
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (14:18): Bert Bos just has a different world view
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:20): hmm http://support.apple.com/kb/HT1222 is blank. I wonder what the latest securit update is about
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:21): I hope it's about making the macports boost build faster
4d05dc3c4352ebe7593b536f2078cfe9 (14:22): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: http://support.apple.com/kb/HT4312
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:22): because I am trying to installed boost now and it's taking forever
4d05dc3c4352ebe7593b536f2078cfe9 (14:23): it seems there is the same PDF fix as iOS
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:23): wonders if OS X 10.4.x has the same hole...
171db427cee236fc04af9e5de94e7c39 (14:24): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: Yeah, bert just lives in a different world.
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:24): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: Sounds like you don't want to be using a system where all development library packages have to be compiled from source
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:24): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: You should try Windows, or Ubuntu
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:24): I'm just curious what people use instead of browsers in that world
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:25): hmm. my OS X session has gone crazy in such a way that it no longer reads new hi-res icons
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:25): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: I like this system well enough, it just need to response better when I press the "Compile faster" button a bunch of times
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:25): all newly launched apps have fuzzy icons in cmd-tab
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:27): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: a mystery of that world is revealed in http://twitter.com/glazou/status/21942696879
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:27): dunno how you missed that one
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:28): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: by working instead of reading every tweet. thanks.
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:28): that's the problem with working
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:28): kicks working
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:29): maybe the "Compile faster" button on my keyboard is broken or something

b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:31): Dear lazy irc: I have a directory full of files checked into SVN. I would like to produce a diff containing all the contents of all the files that are actually in SVN i.e. what you might have thought that svn diff -r revision_before_directory_was_created:HEAD would produce
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:31): Needless to say this does not actually work because svn is lame
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:32): Is there any way to do this that will not cause me to want to stab my own eyes out
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:32): (hint: having to write a script to do this will cause me to want to stab my own eyes out)
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (14:32): generate a list of all files, exclude those not found in the svn repository, and then concatenate those?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:34): 57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450: That sounds plausible, if I can make diff get the base path right for files in subdirectories
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:35): It also sounds like I need to write a script
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:35): Which I was trying to avoid
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (14:35): if you want a diff of the new files
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (14:35): why not clone the svn into a new directory, say /tmp/svnsucks
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (14:35): and then make the diff from that ?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:37): You mean checkout into a new directory?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:41): mkdir /tmp/empty; diff -rN /tmp/empty .
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:41): perhaps?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:41): after doing an svn export to get a clean copy of the files without .svn directories
4d05dc3c4352ebe7593b536f2078cfe9 (14:41): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: you're diff will only have + lines, no ?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:47): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: Something like that seems like it is mostly good enough
4d05dc3c4352ebe7593b536f2078cfe9 (14:47): can't you use the standard diff between your directory and an empty one ?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:48): 4d05dc3c4352ebe7593b536f2078cfe9: That seems to be the approach that I am taking (see e.g. what ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c wrote above)
4d05dc3c4352ebe7593b536f2078cfe9 (14:48): oh yeah, sorry :)
